learning_objectives.objective: Define offsite backup storage and list the full components of the 3-2-1 backup rule (3 copies of data on 2 different types of media, with at least 1 copy offsite or off-network).
Explain the role of offsite backups in ransomware resistance, business continuity, and disaster recovery.
Given a scenario, select appropriate offsite storage solutions (e.g., physical tape vs. cloud) based on organizational needs.
Compare physical vs. cloud offsite backups in terms of cost, security, recovery time objective (RTO), and compliance requirements.
Assess a provided backup plan against NIST Cybersecurity Framework subcategory PR.IP-4 (Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested) and recommend improvements.
Design a customized offsite backup strategy for a mid-sized organization, incorporating the 3-2-1 rule, encryption, air-gapping, and regular testing.
